meanings.definition: To remove branches from (a tree or plant)
meanings.sent1: The gardener disbranched the tree carefully.
meanings.sent2: She disbranched the shrub to help it grow better.
meanings.sent3: The tree felt lighter after being disbranched.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the tree looked disbranched and bare.
meanings.sent5: The act of disbranching made the tree look neat and tidy.

meanings.definition: To separate into branches or divisions
meanings.sent1: The river disbranched into smaller streams.
meanings.sent2: She disbranched the project into manageable tasks.
meanings.sent3: The idea disbranched into various possibilities.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts disbranched like a tree reaching out in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The plan disbranched beautifully, leading to great success.

meanings.sent1: The disbranched tree looked different without its branches.
meanings.sent2: The disbranched plant needed extra care to thrive.
meanings.sent3: The disbranched shrub stood out in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The disbranched tree cast a unique shadow on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The disbranched bush seemed lonely without its branches.
